title: Buccaneers 7, Patriots 0 (1st): Another slow start on defense
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Raymond James Stadium, aiming for a seventh consecutive win.
Patriots' defense starts slowly as Tampa Bay's rookie Egbuka scores a 21-yard touchdown, leading 7-0.
Key players inactive include New England's Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson, and Tampa's Chris Godwin and Mike Evans.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, was arrested on Oct. 19 for allegedly driving under the influence in Boston.
Daveiga crashed his Jeep into a 'no left turn' sign at Leverett Circle and allegedly showed signs of intoxication.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty to DUI and other charges; he's on modified duty and due in court on Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits remain in federal custody after an ICE raid on November 4.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau claims ICE did not allow workers to retrieve documents, and detainee conditions were poor.
DHS claims workers entered the U.S. illegally, but local officials criticize the operation and support detainees.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the November 8 episode of 'Saturday Night Live' with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser's rise to fame began with the 2024 Tom Brady roast and hosting the Golden Globes.
The episode featured highlights like Glaser's monologue and Pete Davidson's return to 'Weekend Update'.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a key late goal against the Maple Leafs to secure the Bruins' 4-3 victory.
Minten was traded from Toronto to Boston in a deal involving Brandon Carlo at last season's trade deadline.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as 'the best player on the ice' after his impactful performance.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara received his Hall of Fame ring and plaque during induction festivities in Toronto.
Chara shared the Hall of Fame honor with fellow Bruin Joe Thornton, who was also inducted in 2025.
Chara's career highlights include a Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star selections, and the 2008-09 Norris Trophy.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are projected to be active in MLB free agency with $25 million below the first luxury tax threshold.
Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, Munetaka Murakami, Dylan Cease, and Framber Valdez linked to Red Sox interests.
Insiders predict Red Sox are favorites to re-sign Bregman; considered strong contender for Schwarber, Alonso, and top pitchers.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, showcasing tracks from his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
Legend varied his setlist by incorporating covers by The Beatles, Kanye West, and Alicia Keys alongside his own songs.
The concert highlighted Legend's musical versatility, featuring both soulful, gospel-inspired songs and upbeat, R&B tracks.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, commenting on fourth quarter calls.
Brown had previously criticized refs after a 105-103 loss to the Jazz for a missed foul call late in the game.
Despite repeated remarks on officiating, Brown avoided a league fine but noted scoring issues in recent games.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Quarterback Baker Mayfield has led the Buccaneers to a 6-2 record with 1,919 passing yards, 13 touchdowns, and two interceptions.
Buccaneers rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka, previously an Offensive Rookie of the Year contender, struggles against man coverage, with only three receptions.
The Buccaneers face receiver injuries with Chris Godwin and Mike Evans out, leaving Sterling Shephard and Tez Johnson likely to see more action.
